Reviews.Title: “perfekt find”
Reviews.Author: simone s
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal to see my boyfriend on small money. I was given very nice complete renoviert budget room. It was perfekt for us. Nice brakefast with bagels und cream cheese. Also close was St Denis street full of restaurants, clubs and romantic cafes. When I come back i will stay here again..Simone

Reviews.Title: “Great make-over!”
Reviews.Author: cutieTraveler101
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since I have stayed at this hotel and have been astonished by the make-over of the budget rooms. The hotel has always been an exceptional value for the location but now the renovated rooms put it over the top!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hostel staff EVER!!! :) When renovations are over this place will be buzzing!!”
Reviews.Author: SweetabixBee
Reviews.Content: Had a awesome week-long stay at the Auberge de Paris this past week. It is a great little hostel in a central location within walking distance of the subway and a number of beautiful attractions. Although the hostel is currently undergoing renovations, the staff were extremely accommodating and allowed me to extend my stay with little notice, while regularly (and unnecessarily) apologizing about the renovations and the current state of the hostel. From viewing photographs of the hostel pre-makeover it is easy to see that the renovations have already begun to bring new life to this great place!! By the summertime it will be buzzing with backpackers looking for the best cheap accommodation in Montreal!! I hope to see updates on the progress of renovations and I will definitely be recommending this hostel and their lovely staff to everyone I know!! :) Diolch...

Reviews.Title: “good find”
Reviews.Author: marc f
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find this hotel. We were just going in to the tourist office and heard Polish language spoken. It was a woman, Dzunia, who owns a Polish restaurant, Mazurka, where we ate later that night. She recommended Hotel de Paris and says she sends her visitor friends there. We booked and had an excellent stay in the lovely building, reminds of Old Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mitch B
Reviews.Content: My buddies came to Montreal for a bachelor party and were looking for a place in a good location at a competitive price. We found a perfect location at an amazing price! We were walking distance from the hub of Montreal's night scene that included an abundance of supper clubs and a casino, a huge plus for out partying needs. Our biggest problem was that the day after the party we had some time to enjoy some shopping and lunch and couldn't decide on all the nearby choices! The service was very friendly and the staff offered us plenty of help with suggestions on how to spend our night Also, after a huge night of partying we got a great night sleep in the dead quiet conditions of the hotel HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: NoryNY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both have kids and needed some space to ourselves. A friend told me about her stay at the hotel and I decided to try it. It was really nice, the staff was friendly, the building clean, and the privacy perfect.

Reviews.Title: “really good value downtown”
Reviews.Author: igal w
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't book because of the bad reviews but am glad I did. stayed here Dec. 1-5. Had a very pleasant stay. Originally booked a budget room but since I was staying 4 days I changed for a executive room in the annex across the street, as the other room though good was a bit small. I am a big guy. Dino, who I think is the manager , was very pleasant and charged me only $15 more per night. All in all a nice little hotel in a great location and 2 spectacular buildings. Art Wimper

Reviews.Title: “Felt right at home.”
Reviews.Author: ivan f
Reviews.Content: My daughter is attending university in Montreal and I come to see her twice a year. This hotel is well located just 2 blocks from St. Denis street. It is quiet and affordable. The building is a great example of pre 1900 architecture. I take an executive room which is large and comfortable. My son and his wife stay in a budget room, which is smaller but has a private bathroom and everything you could need. I will stay here again...Ivan Fulton, Dominican Republic

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jennifer s
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a room at the Hotel de Paris in late summer. We were to stay in the executive suite for 4 nights. I have to say that this was a disappointing place. It appeared that the walls had not been cleaned by the bed, and that 'some matter' was stuck to the wall. Ketchup packages were left around in the kitchen area. There were a few little black dot like things on the white comforter. It smelled bad. The hallway seemed gross. Fortunately, we were able to open the window relieving the smell, and I actually slept well. The air conditioner worked. Still, I would never stay there again. Left after 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “We Thought we found the perfect "French" Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sharkeyguy82
Reviews.Content: My Partner, his mother and myself have been planning this trip to Montreal sense Nov. 2010 so to say we were excited would be a vast understatement. upon arrival to the hotel to check in, our reservations, that we had confirmed before departure, suddenly were not accurate, nor were the rate's. Well talking with the front desk "staff" our rooms were no longer on the same floor or anything like we had reserved. we asked to look at the rooms before we decided what our next move would be and thank god we did... The rooms were more like hostels than hotel rooms and we were very upset. The "staff" was shocked when we told them that we would find something else and were not interested in staying in their "hotel"....

Reviews.Title: “The rudest manager: Hector!!!”
Reviews.Author: genny1738
Reviews.Content: No class. No customer service. When asked for assistance, he told me to buy a laptop and figure it out. Hotel was dirty and the food was absolutely disgusting. By far- the worst hotel I have EVER stayed at

Reviews.Title: “Will look elsewhere next time we're in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kanadai
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at the Hotel de Paris in mid-July. Two friends from Budapest Hungary stayed in one room and three of us stayed in another room. The steps up to the front door are steep and uneven. Our rooms were not too big but the air conditioner just couldn't cool it down. Yes, it was during a heat wave but if the hotel had central air-conditioning it may have been more comfortable. Our bathroom had a bath with a shower (only partly accessible) and a shower. However, the shower we used didn't have a soap or shampoo holder. We had no choice but to leave our soap on the wet shower floor for the next person. The other problem with the bathroom (and this is shared by many hotels I've been in) is the lack of shelf space for our toiletries. There are three of us in a room but the only space for toothbrushes, toothpaste, floss, shavers, shaving cream, etc., etc.. is around the sink. Not nearly adequate! And everything get wet... For breakfast we had to go outside and down those uneven steps to the sidewalk and then walk up some steps to the Bistro de Paris. We had a choice of tea or coffee with either a croissant, muffin or bagel. Plus a small dish of fruit salad. The croissant and muffins are baked fresh and are very nice. The hotel is in an excellent location close to the Sherbrooke Metro stop and the Plateau - Latin quarter. In the past we stayed in several three star hotels in the neighbourhood and we'll likely return to one of them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: teak1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days and had an executive room in the annexed building across the street, on the 1st floor. We loved it! It was very comfortable and met our needs very well! We really enoyed the complimentary breakfast in the morning at the Bistro! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great staff and very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: pamelairene
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at Hotel de Paris 4 times now. Every time I feel that I've gotten a great deal. The rooms are in a charming old building. The rooms are clean, the staff helpful and the location perfect. This is a character hotel, not the quality inn. The restaurants nearby on St Denis and Prince Arthur offer a great diversity.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: rentoon
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel. No frills here but OK got this one because all others are dull. Place is sub par

Reviews.Title: “Small, no frills, affordable”
Reviews.Author: M_Cho83
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor for this hotel, my friends and I were skeptical about staying at this hotel but we kept our reservation because many of the other hotels in the city were completely booked or were too far/unaffordable. In the end however, we were quite happy we decided not to bail. We stayed in the budget room with two queen beds. We were on the main floor. The staff weren't overly friendly but they were helpful and accommodating. When we arrived they were just finishing up cleaning our rooms. They provided plenty of towels and everything was clean. Upon first impression, the room was fine. We got what we paid for, two beds to sleep in and a bathroom (which was very clean and looked as thought it had been recently renovated). One of my friends recently had to move out of her apartment after battling a problem with bedbugs, so when we read one of the reviews on this site which mentioned the possibility of bedbugs, we were determined to seek them out. We stripped the beds and examined the mattresses' seems for evidence and couldn't find a trace of them. Trust me, my friend knew exactly what to look for and was satisfied the whole room was free of them. The hotel was in the perfect location. We could easily walk to both Old Montreal and Downtown. And if not, the cab ride was incredibly affordable, SO much cheaper than cabs in Toronto (where we are from). The hotel is not new and no frills, so don't expect the Four Seasons. But it provided exactly what we were looking for, an affordable place in a great location to stay while visiting Montreal for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple, no-frills hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RajofMooses
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an "Executive" room in the building across the street. While calling it "Executive" is probably a stretch, the room was perfectly clean, comfortable and spacious (although somewhat bare) with a comfy (and firm!) bed and nice wood floors. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but that was no big deal for us. The staff were friendly and helpful both on the phone and in person. The building had its charms but was a little cluttered. Great location, being near the restaurants and bars on St. Denis. We didn't even try the breakfast (I stayed in the hostel part of the hotel years ago as a student and still remember how crappy it was!) and opted for a full breakfast at a restaurant instead. We took advantage of a web discount that made the place a good value; otherwise I think the room would have been a bit overpriced. All in all -- nice, simple place wihout the fussiness of a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cosy and close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Sydneytraveller41
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed here for a week. The room we were given was not the room I had requested, so approached the Concierge who very obligingly organised for the correct room to be made available within 2 hours. It was the large "turret" room directly above reception on the first floor. It has the biggest "king" bed we have ever seen - commonly referred to by staff as the "naughty" bed, plus a comfy sofa bed. The room has its own balcony and lovely views. Complementary breakfast is available in the little cafe next door. The staff were friendly and very happy to help with any of our enquiries. The only down side was lugging all our suitcases up those stairs!!!! We were about 2 blocks from Sherbrooke Station on the Metro which is very easy to use. Could be a bit noisy from traffic if you're used to total quiet. After long days of sightseeing our room was a welcome retreat.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've seen! Bedbugs, dirty sheets, broken curtain rail and phone!”
Reviews.Author: bakhshinyan
Reviews.Content: Just stay away of this plase! These guys never heard of vacuum cleaner and duster! We couldn't spent there even one night. I understand that budget room suppose to be rather modest. But why everything in the room has to be brocken or covered with dust?!? And the blood dots on the pillow cases caused by bedbugs are just unspeakable!!! And they ask 100 dollars for this garbage. We ran out of this place after an houre, went just a few meters till the next corner and checked in the next hotel, nice, clean and cosy, for the same 100 cad.

Reviews.Title: “Good... but could be better”
Reviews.Author: down_2_earth96
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was ok. The tv was tiny and only really started to work on the last night we stayed. The beds were nice..comfortable. The bathroom was the worst part. The toilet was right accross from the door so i was almost impossible to sit down and overall, way too small. There were no drawers, only "cubbies". A coat hanger served as a closet. One of the windows refused to close. Overall noise was at a minimum. At night, you could hear people in the hall quite loudly because it was creaky. The front service desk manager was very nice and could understand English very well and gave us directions to the highway. Awesome complementry breakfast at a small, frenchy cafe next door.

Reviews.Title: “hair on bed,opened my door while we are sleeping.”
Reviews.Author: ROCKET2001
Reviews.Content: i was there to stay one night only.NOMORE because there hairs on the bed sheets.n pillow.it looks like they never clean the bed sheets.but the towle are clean.the worst thing is THAT THEY OPENED MY DOOR WHILE MY GIRLFRIEND WAS IN THE WASHROOM AND I WAS ON THE BED.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: yakimandel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in the Plateau area of Montreal, 2 blocks from St Denis where you can dind all the restos, clubs and night life, but also the rooms are very quiet. There is a hotel with all kinds of rooms from high end to budget, apparently no 2 rooms are alike. There is also a youth hostel, slightly segregated, so if you are young or want to mix with hostellers you can and can also prepare your own food in the common area kitchen which is well equipped. My colleague and I organize training seminars and we will probably book here again. It was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDave154943
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value hotel. I paid under 60 dollars a night had a nice room, with an older (but very nice) style to it with a clean bathroom and comfortable queen bed. I am really picky with hotel rooms, this one was perfectly fine. The location was great, near a giant park and St Denis street, with tons of good restaurants and nightlife. It is an older hotel, and has a really nice charm to it. The staff were polite and helpful. There is a hostel as well, I didn't stay there, but the hotel part certainly met expectations. We stayed for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Great little hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but very decent”
Reviews.Author: Istigkeit
Reviews.Content: This place is totally fine. Not fancy by any means, but clean and friendly. You kind of get the feeling you are staying with relatives that you are just meeting for the first time. Clean even if slightly weathered. It is hostel like but the rooms are nice with newly renovated bathrooms. I could take it but will try something else next time...

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD FIND”
Reviews.Author: victorine123
Reviews.Content: We choose the Hotel de Paris due to the proximity of the Notre Dame Hospital where a relative was hospitalized. We were surprised on arrival to find out that the room we had requested was in another building across the street but the reception clerk explained to us that the category of accommodation we had reserved was not in the old house. We were a bit concerned but when we checked in our room, we were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of the facilities: queen size bed with a white duvet, beautiful bathroom, warm decor and windows overlooking the street. And very quiet. We also found the staff in general to be very helpful, always taking the time to give us directions or to recommend available restaurants and stores in the neighborhood. Extra requests were dealt with promptly and as when we arrived, when we left, assistance was provided to us for our luggage without asking directly for it. We are elderly and such attentions are always appreciated. We will come back, not only because the rate we paid was very competitive but we also felt cared for, without pretention but with friendliness and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE...WARNING IT WAS NASTY”
Reviews.Author: mialove09
Reviews.Content: My Aunt decided to take me to Montreal for my 36 b day.what i came back to new York with was bed bug bites all over my body.I stayed in room 29...I have pictures to prove this.I stayed there and I will regret it for as long as i live.I will never return to Montreal...ever..and people say New York is the dirty place..that is a big judgement call.I leave NY to get bitten.write to me I will send you proof.miafig74@msn.com..please do not stay in this hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “False advertising”
Reviews.Author: JoanD50
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place was the location. Room was not what was advertised. The bed had the loudest boxspring I have ever slept on or not slept on as was the case here. The bathroom was clean and new but they should spend a few dollars on a shower head so that you do not have to run around to get hit by the sparse water flow. Breakfast in the morning was last weeks croissants, watery coffee and rotten, yes rotten fruit salad. I would never recommend this place. One nice thing was the gentleman that checked us in . He could not have been politer and confessed that he too was tired of travellers complaining about how the establishment did not reflect what is stated and pictured on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Think carefully and then pack earplugs”
Reviews.Author: flying_kiwi120
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently having booked a budget room - bad mistake! I walked in and the airconditioning unit was so loud i could barely think. The only window that opened was about 30 sq cm, and opened onto the main, noisy through road. I asked to change rooms, the first time I have ever done that, and was taken to another. The only improvement on the first was that the air conditioner, although still very noisy, seemed to be more effective, and my hope was that I could chill the room through the day and turn it off over night. I was obviously jet lagged at the time as this thinking was way off the mark!! The front desk staff varied - from the arrogant and rude pratt obviously discussed already in this forum, to a charming man who could not be more helpful and changed me to a room where I could at least hang up my clothes. I can not imagine where the photos on the website were taken. This "hotel" is more on the "hostel" end of the spectrum, but if your expectations are realistic, and you are prepared to ignore the rude man, it is probably ok for a night or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even get beyond making the reservation...”
Reviews.Author: JU9091
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on this hotel, I still decided to call and make a reservation. The man who answered the phone was so unbelievably rude, abrupt and unfriendly that I decided right then there would be no way I would stay in this hotel. Every question I asked he answered as though I had just asked the stupidest thing possible.... aren't hotel staff supposed to be courteous and friendly? Considering that almost half of the reviews on this websit are NOT in favour of this hotel, at the very least the management should ensure that the staff are polite (unless of course, this man was the manager himself). Even though the room rate was decent, there is no way I would stay in a place where the staff are rude.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant find with great value for money”
Reviews.Author: falconon
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a very cozy bedroom decorated with taste and in keeping with the general atmosphere of the old house (Victorian era). The location was ideal, near a metro station and within walking distance of the Quartier Latin and Old Montreal. There was a beautiful park near by great for jogging in the morning. Breakfast was simple but tasty, included in the price. Great selection of restaurants on near St Denis street. Comfortable bed with crisp and clean white duvet. The best is the Front staff. So helpful and so willing to help for any request. The housekeeping was also sweet when we requested extra pillows and bathroom linen. For what we paid, it was a real good value for money. We will go back anytime

Reviews.Title: “Its a youth hostel, not hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanMV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible, No where was it advertised as a hostel otherwise we would not have slept there. We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel and this was an overcharged youth hostel. The location was not the greatest, you still had to get on the metro to get to the nice areas of Montreal. The hotel was very dated, the pictures of their site must have been taken over 30 years ago! We checked out early and would not stay here again if someone paid us too. The beds were small and very uncomfortable, the rooms smelled, the TVs were minature and didn't work too well. The carpets were stained and the whole place needs to be renovated and painted to look better. You feel dirty just being in the hotel and sleeping in the bed. It was not worth any money. They charge $10 per day parking in a building across the street, the parking lot looked very unsafe and shady and no one else was parked in there - I didn't feel good leaving our 10 year old car there..Unless you want to stay at a hostel, I wouldn't recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: SAMZYAT
Reviews.Content: very old, their website doesn't reflect the reality , poor service , noisy old fashioned air conditioning , mold and humid in the rooms , we stayed in a so called family room , that you cannot even open a window very dark, the staff were not helpful at all ,we asked them many times to fix the lamp that is going almost to fall on my son head but was not fixed and i had to use a tooth pick , cheap breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - I moved after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Ermatjie
Reviews.Content: It always depends on the needs of the traveller, and that makes it difficult to evaluate other people's opinions, unless they stated exactly who they are, for what purposes they needed the room, etc. I was on a course in MontrÃ©al, wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room, apart from the evenings when I needed a desk to study. I was put in a small room with a tiny bathroom, which smelled of smoke, and was mainly dark except for the kitchenette which had a door that opened with difficulty. The desk/table I had requested was not suitable, and I was overall not satisfied with the state of the hotel - very run-down. The bistro looked cosy, but the personnel there was certainly not accommodating. I went for my breakfast early (around 7:30 - being jetlagged) and by 11:30 was hungry again (studying gives me the munchies) When I went down to order a sandwich, I was told this was not possible, since they were closing after serving breakfast and that "they didn't have time to do that now". It seems that they operate seperately from the hotel, which wouldn't be a problem, unless one encountered an attitude like this. The other hotel guests were mainly groups of young people, possibly more from the youth hostel than from the hotel. I didn't find the location thÃ¡t fantastic, compared to some of the other reviews. To their credit, the reception staff was INCREDIBLY friendly, both over the phone and in person, and they were extremely pleasant, even when I checked out after my only night, having had a reservation for 3 nights. I then moved to HÃ´tel Tour la Centre Ville, where I payed the same price for a 100 square meter apartment and was much more central. Their internet also worked well, for free, as promised. I don't mind staying in simple locations and I wanted something in this price range, but again, one has to look at other comparisons within the same range.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down - Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: soccerdude28
Reviews.Content: Simple seeing the building from the outside was enough to say, gross! The building is run down, and the steps to walk into the hotel are uneven and haunted looking. As you go inside to check in, the hotel seems reasonable. Following up the stairs through the maze of the hallways and into your room, disaster strikes. The room is tiny, two double beds with about a foot and a half in between. A large dusty window with a tree and roofing shingles hanging outside, and a dirty bathroom with three used thin soap bars and 2 toilet paper rolls. The phone does not work, and the tv is one of the original 10 inch screens. There are holes in the walls and insects everywhere. The staff is rude, and if you plan to experience the nightlife, dont bother trying to get back to your hotel late at night without an unpleasant experience through the lobby. Dirty looks and rude greetings. If you are on the second or higher floor, you will experience the secondary stairway, which leads to the communal basement. The kitchen is clean if you want to use it in front of everyone. Although down the stairs you will see rolling baskets and wheel chairs and garbage bags on the steps. When you get to the main floor, you attempt to open the door to the outside, only to notice that it has been screwed to its frame. The whole hotel makes for an unpleasant visit. Also, dont forget your complimentary breakfast! A gross muffin or croissant with a shot glass full of juice at the tiny bistro built into the hotel. Yum! NEVER AGAIN! Spend the 50 extra dollars and stay at the hilton or something else a little bit cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location... Good Rooms... GREAT Service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clubtraveler1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a long weekend trip to experience Montreal. GREAT Location... Walking distance to St. Catherine... Old Montreal through the fun parts of Downtown, EXTREMELY close to the metro and easy to get to. I would DEFLY recommend staying here if you want to experience Montreal, especially St. Catherine St. The rooms were updated and clean. Stayed in the Annex, which I recommend. The Staff was by far superior, especially the manager Paul. I would stay here again in a heart beat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; Phenomenal staff”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler1982
Reviews.Content: Good accommodations in an excellent location for a reasonable price. Comfortable, spacious rooms were exactly the home base we needed to explore the city and nightlife. Breakfast included from the Bistro was a nice plus. When our car got broken into (recommend paying a little extra to park in the hotel's garage instead of street parking) the hotel staff could not have been more helpful. Paul came to the rescue of these three American travelers and helped us deal with the difficult situation from every angle -- always exceedingly gracious. Recommend Hotel De Paris to any travelers visiting Montreal. We'll definitely stay here the next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Zharik
Reviews.Content: Like others, I was pleased with the exterior and location of the Hotel de Paris, but very dissapointed with the room itself. It was cramped, and dirty (we actually had a plane of sheet glass sitting behind one of the curtains in our room, leaning against the TV cabinet). We cycled into Montreal, and stayed here based on the fact that it had the Route Verte certification, but were very dissapointed with the bicycle parking amenities (we were told to bring our tandem bike up two flights of stairs to place in our room).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but disappointing overall, and definitely over-priced”
Reviews.Author: pndontour
Reviews.Content: First thing I should mention is that we stayed in the annex across across the road from the main hotel. "Run down" would be the expression that would most accurately describe the place. Either that or "done on the cheap". The towels were thin and small, and they were replaced on a seemingly random basis. The building itself could have been doing with a lick of paint, and the exterior garden was overgrown and shabby. Little things that are easly fixed but make a big impression - clearly the owners do not see this as a priority. For example, the cleanliness left a lot to be desired (dusty shelf, floor could have been swept with a bit more effort) and the shower cubicle was tiny (was really hard to move around in - let's just say if you were even slightly obese you would have a job even getting into it!). There was a stained old rug on the floor which I made a point of avoiding when walking barefoot! The window shutters were cumbersome, and the AC unit was completely and utterly useless - it clearly hadn't been cleaned in eons, and therefore served no purpose other than to sound like a jumbo jet taking off. Breakfast isn't worth mentioning - go to Cora's and enjoy a proper meal! PLUS: Good location. MINUS: No working AC facility despite being listed as such.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near McGill”
Reviews.Author: NoryNY
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this small hotel which is in a very good location.I was able to walk everywhere I wanted togo. I took the suite. It had a balcony overlooking the old city. My twin daughters who will attend McGill next year stayed in a budget room. The staff were helpful and prices were very reasonable for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique type hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Paris on the long May weekend. We had a very cute room on the second floor of the hotel with a queen bed at a very reasonable price. The room was spotless and the staff friendly. It is a smaller hotel, not a chain and that's what I liked about it, it has tons of character and is just a pleasant relaxing place to be. Great location near a ton of restaurants and the metro. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: mamadow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, many many many stairs! Clean rooms, we stayed in a budget two star and it was small, however the bathroom was completely new, and the sheets were clean. front desk is very kind and helpful. Excellent location if you want to walk to the village or latin quarter. And Rue st catherine is about a 10 dollar cab ride. Breakfast was modest, but just enough to get you started in the morning choice of fresh muffin or croissent with tea/coffee and a small cup of juice. Could not ask for more at 89 dollars a night. Honestly if your going to drink or shop and dont plan on using your room for anything other than a place to sleep. Hotel de Paris is a great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “It is a great pace to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler35quebec
Reviews.Content: I came with 2 other friends on a cross-country trip and they set us up in the Hostel area. The staff were really nice and were able to give us great advice on activities. We also made friends with another group of young people in the lounge and ended up going on excursions togetherâ€”we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel de Paris. I was on business in Montreal and loved the location close enough to walk to all my meetings downtown and some great restaurants. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable and had free WIFI and a small desk to complete all my work. The hotel has character and friendly staff. Definitely a more enjoyable experience than another Holiday Inn. I would definitely go back especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of All Time”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveller2
Reviews.Content: Awful experience at Hotel de Paris, Montreal. Hotel is divided between two buildings on either side of Sherbrooke Street. This is quite inconvenient as I will explain. Please read my review of this horrible place. The towels were frayed, thin, small. The bed sheets were thread-bare and see-through. No extra blankets. No shampoo or conditioner, lotion as is customary at most hotels. No clock, tv was very small, shower curtain was too small for the shower opening, water all over because of this. Shower curtain rod was a tension rod that slipped down the shower walls and fell down with every shower taken. Bed was old, creeky, extremely poor quality mattress. Lamp and room lighting was poor. Large wooden window shutters instead of curtains or blinds were difficult and cumbersome and allowed in full view from the street or zero. Room did not have a coffee machine and breakfast voucher from cafe was a rip. If you want to take your bagel and coffee from the cafe to go you are forced to pay extra to do so for each breakfast. When questioned why, they were hard pressed to provide an answer. The room was not supplied with kleenex tissues and had only one roll of toilet paper. I had to cross the street and ask for another. The closet and room in general was small. Bathroom was miniscule. It looks like they tried to spend money on the finishes. The washroom had nice tiles and the shower looked nice. However, the taps made this extremely high pitched, loud sound when the shower was running. It sounded like a fire alarm going off and nothing we adjusted could make the sound dissipate. They should have spent the money on details like this instead of pretty tiles. I woke up to the smell of cigarette smoke on Saturday morning. When I spoke to the front desk about it they said that no one was smoking in the rooms. I'm not sure how they could know that for sure from across the street. No one offered to look into it or follow up with me. Customer service lacking. I can't think of one thing that was positive about this experience. All around, it was the WORST HOTEL I have ever stayed at. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Go elsewhere and be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “very good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirenaToronto
Reviews.Content: I had been staying in Old Montreal at the Nineteenth Century hotel for a few days. Changed to Hotel de Paris downtown in the plateau, better price and better location. This is another beautiful building. The lobby was under renovation but my room (I asked for a luxury room) was great. It was huge and had a large balcony overlooking the city. There is a youth hostel attached to the hotel and it was a nice place to meet some young people. Ann Munster

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Experiences”
Reviews.Author: ksbro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst in my experience. Don't stay there if you are over 25. It is noisy inside and out, and the room was tiny and dirty. Don't be fooled by the romantic sounding name either...there's Nothing charming about this dilapidated old building.

Reviews.Title: “not good hotel, it is a hostal.. for backpacker”
Reviews.Author: MXvoyager1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not really a hotel, it is a house refurnished to be a hotel, old very old beds, tv, etc, no shampo, small towels, breakfast offered is : bagel+coffe+ orange juice sample. They have no clean up the room in the hotel, neither trash pick up nor bed cleaning. For the price we paid + 15 CAD per night, we can stay at Queen Elizabeth FairmontÂ´s hotel, so watch out There is "free wireless" internet and local calls free. No parking at all, closest is a Double Tree parking lot about two blocks. If you are backpacker it is ok, but for same amount of money you mabe can get a better and real hotel. No lugage help, front desk people in morning has very bad attitude, by the way we are paying..., to guest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot when I am in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BirdLives
Reviews.Content: I find myself in Montreal on business and pleasure a few times a year. I had stayed at this Hotel a few years back, and had really enjoyed it. I decided on my latest trip, to stay there again, as it is perfectly located for me to be able to walk to my meetings, and then to be near the part of town I enjoy most at night (the St. Denis area). The hotel has a very personal feel, the staff are friendly and helpful. The building is architecturally beautiful, with the unique look you see in Montreal, and also with its castle like turrets. In fact I stayed in one of the "turret" rooms, which was large and comfortable. The room, and the bathroom were large, clean, and up to date, Check in and out is simple and easy, with a personal touch. Unlike the large sterile McHotels that are in downtown Montreal this one has a unique charm.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Humblinglion
Reviews.Content: I work for Smarter Travel which is under the Expedia umbrella. so we received a certificate that we had to use on Expedia. we usually stay at Bed& Breakfast spots when we go to Montreal but we couldn't find one on Expedia so we went with a hotel. My stepmom and my my father live in Montreal so we usually have them go and check out the spots after we book them and they told us that the bathroom was beautiful and that the hotel was in a decent area except if you go down one side street it gets shady. but overall she said the room that they showed here was pretty nice. WRONG! it was tiny. I mean you open the door an dthe bed is right there to your left. not even an inch away from the door. there was one chaie and one huge window facing another building. the bathroom was small, that you couldn't take s hower without your elbow touching the shower wall. The temperature of the water would just change on it's own. It was a nice looking bathroom, which is deceiving, until you get in and realize how tiny it reallly is. If you suffer from clostophobia DO NOT stay at Hotel de Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Theft of items at Hotel de Paris”
Reviews.Author: elkport
Reviews.Content: Our room was entered while we were away during the day and an assortment of items were stolen. We reported this to the hotel management, submitted a very legitimate claim for $480. and then was "stonewalled" by the owner and manager for a few weeks. Promises were made and not kept. After constant contact with them, they sent a check for $350. They never reported this to the police. Garage for car is a joke at $8.00 per night. Breakfast was a shoddy excuse.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: yevalve
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. We are a group of students from Vermont and din't want to stay at a Holiday Inn. Very nice building at least 100 years old. Rooms were large, although they told us they had small budget rooms too. All in all a very good location, quiet but close to all the restaurants and nightlife downtown. Helpful front sesk sent us to Prince Arthur Street for supper and took time ro explain how to get around.

Reviews.Title: “very good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: monika92
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel, right near St. Denis and Park Lafonataine. Had a fine time sitting on the balcony and looking down to the river. Freindly staff. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “escellente lugar”
Reviews.Author: jessu
Reviews.Content: I like dis hotel. Lovely to walk near here. Nice vista from balcony en frente. Workers almost all know to speak spanich. Freidly lugar. Linda edifidio...Yessee, Costa Rica

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away --- Stay Away --- Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: Lovelife1
Reviews.Content: Well let's just say we paid for a room and never slept --- we were given a key to room 46 - that is the size of a closet door that lead up to a attic that had two double size matress laying on a floor in each side of the room and had two double size beds that were in the middle of the room - toilet seat falling off - no soap to watch your hands and none of the lamps work -- as I can see they don't send anyone up to the attic to clean --- if there was a fire our whole family would be dead - as this is a very scary and awful room to be put in without any source of escaping - We called numberous of time to find out if our parking stale was reserved and told yes twice to find out that one of the parking stale the worker at the time had no idea ---- If anyone stayed here recently obiviously didn't have the luck we had. For anyone going to stay good luck hopefully you will have better luck. This is a three star room rated by the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: OZLJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. A 10 minute walk from the bus station and St Dennis shopping area. The room was large and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the little cafe bext door... basic but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all purpose hotel, Spectacular building”
Reviews.Author: regular92
Reviews.Content: this hotel seems to be constantly trying to get better. Everytime I have stayed here there was someting new. This time, breakfast is included in the price and is served in a really nice little Bistro downstairs, run by a funny Frenchman from, of course, Paris. There are a few types of room from budget to superior. I like the superior rooms in the Annex across the street. They are large and comfotable. We couldn't connect to the wifi which works haphzardly in our building but had free internet access to the wired terminal in the lobby.. I don"t even consider going elsewhere, the staff seems genuinely happy to converse and is friendly and helpful. They also remember me. I like that.

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: lmmair
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very wonderful. The workers there were very pleasant. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were large and the price was not expensive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: Wribbet
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific little hotel with friendly staff and if you like heritage buildings this is one lovely Victorian. I stayed in a deluxe room with my boyfriend for 2 nights. We had a balcony and great view of downtown. Dino at the front desk helped us find all the great night spots in town. I will come back here. Julia Grenouille

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoKrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights right before New Year's and we will definitely stay here again when we are in Montreal the next time. Definitely a good budget location for backpackers or. The location is great and there are a bunch or restaurants and pubs withing a walking distance. The room was a good size, beds were comfortable enough and the staff was very helpful. The bathroom was fairly small, but I have to say that it was clean. The same cannot be said about the carpets in the room, especially under the beds, as it looks like it has not been vacuumed for weeks. The parking situation was decent, as there were parking places on both sides of Sherbrooke as well as on Saint-Andre, next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY!! Avoid the nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBostonian
Reviews.Content: My experience with Hotel De Paris was so bad that I went out of my way to create a tripadvisor account and write this review! I also want to agree with another comment regarding the assumption that the good reviews were written by the hotel staff/owner. If you look at their accounts, you will see that those accounts were used only once to write those reviews. I found this hotel on hotwire.com. Since I usually have good luck with hotwire, I booked Hotel De Paris for 3 nights over New Years weekend. The hotel was rated 3 stars (comparable to a Doubletree), so I paid $100 a night. Hotel De Paris is the worst hotel I ever stayed at!!! The hotel is really dirty and smells. The room was tiny. The carpet was dirty and didnâ€™t look like it was vacuumed for a very long time. The sheets and comforter were disgusting and didnâ€™t look like theyâ€™ve been washed. The walls were extremely thin (you can hear everything). The bathroom had stains and was gross. The hotel should be rated 1 star or a low scale hostel. I tried to upgrade/switch room, but the other rooms were worse. FYI, I checked out their web site and the rooms are nowhere close to the pictures. Also, I woke up after the third night (this morning) with bed bug bites on my arms and legs. I have already written an email to hotwire telling them that I will never use their service again. Please do yourself a favor and never stay at this hotel! Our friends got into the Hyatt (priceline) for the same price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, and possibly disease ridden”
Reviews.Author: desertsister
Reviews.Content: They don't mention anywhere on their website that they are also a hostel. Not to mention a very bad hostel who puts their guests in the musty basement. I am so sorry for anyone who books this hotel. Their pictures on their website are so cute and quaint, but I swear these rooms do not exist. The hotel staff is not friendly and helpful as some of the reviews state. I really think the positive reviews are writen by the hotel staff themselves. The walls were so thin that I could hear my neighbors urinating and every other sound they made! I can't believe this hotel has not been shut down for fraud. It truly is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Do yourself a favor, and stay someplace safe and nice for the same price! THE PLACE SMELLS AND THE SHEETS WERE FILTHY! Even worse, the front desk refused to refund my first night stay when I informed them I could not possibly sleep in such a dirty bed. I left and found a room at the Sheraton downtown and actually payed less than the Hotel de Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a total scam; go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with the hotel through their website for one night, 2 July 2006. My sister made a separate reservation for a 3-star superior room, for herself and her fiance for the same days. We both received e-mail confirmations. The day before we were expected to arrive, I received a phone call from the desk confirming a room upgrade to a 3-star superior room, I had made several weeks earlier. The man asked what time to expect my arrival and I stated that I will be arriving in the evening. He confimed everything and I assumed everything would go according to plan. When we arrived at the hotel, we stated at the desk that we had reservations, to which the young man at the desk asked "If we had brought our own sheets?". Bewildered, we said "No" to which the man responded that it would be "$3 per night for sheets." My sister then asked, "Is this a hotel?" The man stammered and said "Yes" and then proceeded to shuffle through a batch of receipts from individuals that had checked in. Then he said that he couldn't find our reservations based on these receipts. Neither of us could figure out why he didn't simply check the computer in front of him for our reservations. And how is it that I received a phone call from the hotel confirming my reservation the day before? The man said that the individual in question didn't know what he was talking about. We insisted that since he lost both our reservations (An unlikely coincidence) that he do us the courtesy of find us rooms. He insisted there was no space at the hotel. Strange, considering that 10 min. prior he was willing to offer us a room, albeit with their 'hostel' annex. He sent us to a shabby motel, saying that they had two rooms available. They did not. We went back, fuming. Finally, they made arrangements at a Best Western, more expensive, using my contact information, mysteriously made available from the computer. How is it that our reservations were lost when he was able to pull my name from the hotel computer? We spoke with the Hotel de Paris manager, Hector Zana, on the phone, who said that the hotel would pick up the difference in the room rates when we checked out the following day. However, when we called the manager, he was extremely rude and denied ever having the conversation or offering to pick up the difference in our tabs. We promptly called the police, which got the same rude response from the manager. What's worse, the manager said that we made the reservation through a non-affiliated website- a blatant lie as the hotel had sent us e-mail confirmations when we made the reservations. So here we were stuck paying $50 more after spending hours arguing with these people. Plus, we had to call our credit cards making sure that we were charged for the missed reservations as our accounts on the hotel's website were still 'active'. Our theory, that there are no such 3-star rooms and when the hotel realized that's what we were expecting, conveniently 'lost' 2 seperate reservations and bamboozled us by promising to cover the extra expense of costlier rooms elsewhere. Despite their nice website, this is not a true hotel but a hostel run by a bunch of con artists.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Hotel de Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bastet412
Reviews.Content: After making a reservation with the Hotel de Paris more then a month and a half ago and receiving a confirmation from their website, I assumed that my vacation in Montreal would go with out a hitch. Upon checking in, I tell the person at the desk that I have a reservation for the superior Queen Room in Annex 1. He then asks me if I want sheets...silly question of course! I then ask if the hotel de Paris was a hotel, to which he replies yes, but they also have a hostel. (What kind of hotel is â€œ3 Starâ€� and has a hostel?) Anyway, the "concierge" proceeds to search for my reservation everywhere but the computer and informs me that he couldn't find my reservation and that the hotel was completely booked. Even with the confirmation information he was unwilling to be accommodating. There is a computer in the lobby and I checked my reservation and it was still active. How is it that they were unable to locate it? After almost 3 hours of trying to find us a room, the person at the desk finally called the Sam W, who I assume is the owner of the hotel. Sam W, instructed the person at the desk to find us a room in another hotel. The first â€œhotelâ€� was Hotel de la Cassa. If this location is comparable to the Hotel de Paris then they really should remodel. First we had to be buzzed in to the Hotel de la Cassa and the women was behind what looked like a prison window and did not speak either French or English well and frankly the lobby smelled like cat pee. We needed two rooms and there was only one, so we had to return to the Hotel de Paris. Upon seeing us again, the person at the desk called back Sam W. After several minutes of them conversing Sam W promised that they would find us a room in another hotel and that the Hotel de Paris would pick up the difference. All we would have to do is call the manager Monday morning Hector Z. This was an obvious lie, because upon checking out of the hotel that they found for us on Monday, we called the manager Hector Z and he proceeded to say that Sam W had never spoken to him and that it wasnâ€™t his problem and that the reservation that I had made was through an independent web-site; not true at all since I went to the Hotel de Paris website and made the reservation through them and received a confirmation through the Hotel. After suspecting fraudulent activity (I am still monitoring my credit card) I contacted the police who said they would make a note of our situation, but it was a civil matter. I have my suspicions if they are actually a hotel. I am unsure why the Hotel de Paris is so highly rated. I would really think twice before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Total Nightmare!!! Beware all!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw the hotel's website and liked the pictures of the rooms so I reserved their largest hotel room for my family. I should have heeded the other terrible reviews on this site, but like a fool I chose to stay here. It is not conveniently located as the reviews state as well. I have a feeling the hotel staff writes the good reveiws themselves. The building has been remodeled, but very badly. When we got to our room and opened the door, the smell was terrible and the room was the shabbiest $150 a night room I had ever seen. Although the bathroom was remodeled, it did not make up for the dirty green carpet, non working tv, tiny room for 6, and dirty radiator with garbage inside the floor area arouond the radiator. One of the beds, which were hard as rocks had a pull out bed. When I pulled it out, the sheets were filthy and the actual pullout drawer was disgusting, full of dirt and hair. When I informed the guy at the front desk, he said he would get us new sheets. My husband insisted on speaking with the owner, but the front desk guy said he had no idea where he was or when he would be there. We had to pay for one night, but never ended up staying there. That would have ruined our trip to Montreal. We got a room at the Springhill Suites in Old Town instead for $15 more a night. Also, the parking for $8 they offer is street parking and you cannot park on the street from 3 to 5 pm. We also found out the place mostly rents out beds to people who cannot afford rooms. The environment around the hotel was shady. We actually saw a group of people doing drugs around the corner. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Make yourself at home...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I stay at L`Hotel de Paris in Montreal. It seems everytime I come it only gets better. They have a variety of room types available. This time I opted for the suite (room 37 i think it was) and i gotta say, wow! Its a large room, with a big bed and a nice balcony up front. It seems they`ve done some renovations over the winter because i noticed all the corridors have been redone and really spruces up the place. A nice new thing they offer is a free continental breakfast. They also have a Bistro on site but it was only opening in April. The staff is very friendly and really make you feel at home. Its not a huge hotel so I guess it is easier to make a personal connection with the clients. There`s a new young guy working there whos a lot of fun and full of good advice about the city. I recommend this place and I`d defintalely keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I attend a conference in Montreal every December and stay here all the time. The rooms are clean and comfortable and for the first time this year they added a free breakfast! I noticed that there were some other changes also and the place is quaint and very Montreal. I find the location convenient, the staff reliable and friendly and I like the price!

Reviews.Title: “the room matters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based entirely on the price. The adds said 69$ so i figured, if it's decent, for that price i'd stay. And the 69$ price, was the value of the room. It was not perfectly kept, but i was good enough to sleep in for me, and i'd say most people. Then i asked what the other more expensive rooms were like, and they said: "nicer" So i had a look, and for some more money, the rooms were a significant step up. So, i bought a more expensive room, and it was luxurious. I think that the bad reviews about the rroms are from people paying 69$ for a room and expective the luxury suites. Look if you pay the 120$ to get the luxury sweet you get a luxury swet, it you pay 69 buck, you get a 69$ room. Hotel de paris is not the greatest deal of all time, but it's fair, and you get what you pay for, plus there are some perks, lik the nice costomer service. I'd stay here again jim, from victoria BC

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed when I got to my room. I had high expectations due to all of the good reviews this place was receiving. I rented a standard 2 double bedroom suite. There were holes in the walls, loose tiles in the washroom, mold on the walls in the washroom, not enough towels.... the only good thing about this hotel was the customer service. The people at the desk were friendly and gave us information regarding places to visit/go in montreal. overall: very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “For a good time in Montreal follow these directions...”
Reviews.Author: klickbot
Reviews.Content: I have been to Montreal a number of times and have stayed at this hotel a few times. Basically, it is cheap, clean and central with a good dose of old world charm. However-when I visited this time my whole view of the hotel-and Montreal-completely changed. WHAT A HOTEL CAFE! The food was fantastic, super cheap, and the girls running it really made my visit! They made me maps and told me exactly where to go to really experience Montreal. I have been to Montreal a number of times but this time was the first I didn't feel like a tourist. The cafe is a meeting point for fellow travellers and local, with people meeting up for coffee or drinks while they explore the city. Apparently they also have a hip hop brunch on Saturdays! It's all the best of Montreal-vibrant and hip while remaining friendly and accessible. I am planning my next visit right now-and wouldn't stay anwyhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a girls night out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel a bunch of times now and we simply love it! Everytime we go to Montreal for a girls night out, we always rent the ATTIC room (room 43 I think)and we have a blast! We usually are 6 - 8 girls, so for us, the deal is great. There is plenty of room for everyone to sleep - the room has 4 double beds, so no one ever has to sleep on the floor! Girls, just one tip though - bring an extra mirror! There is only one in the bathroom and it's tiny!! Just to avoid any cat fights!LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Room in Hotel De Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They charge you first($150/night) then show you the aweful room. Then they say if you want a better room you have to pay more!! if you want to leave you have to pay for first night!! It is rip off business going on this hotel. It was very bad. They have ruined PARIS's name. a guest for two nights Sep/2,3/2005.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: jafrogg
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel de Paris (not the hostel next door) for the third time with my husband. We really enjoy the place, but I think it is probably not for everyone. First, it would not be for anyone with bad knees. Just getting into the lobby is quite a steep climb from the street. Second, it would not be for light sleepers - at least not on summer weekends. Montreal is a late-night town, and the rooms at the front, especially, get a lot of street noise. That said, we like to stay in the front, in one of two rooms with a rooftop balcony - a fantastic place to chill with a beverage and some conversation. In fact, the balcony is the whole point for us - the view of Rue Sherbrooke and downtown is wonderful. We've stayed in both rooms that share the balcony, and they were both nice. We were much less impressed with the standard, balcony-less room where we stayed on our first visit. Of course, the balcony makes sense only in the summer. In the winter it's likely to have four feet of snow on it. The hotel would not be a bad choice in the neighborhood, even if you opt for the less expensive rooms without the balcony. It's clean enough, the staff is decent, the decor is pleasant if slightly faded. But there may be better choices. In fact, in winter we prefer to stay across the street and down a block at the more comfortable but slightly less atmospheric Hotel Chateau de l'Argoat. If you do stay in the neighborhood, don't miss Parc LaFontaine, a great place for a stroll or a run. In winter there is ice skating in a pond with high embankments that protect skaters from the wind. I'm also a big fan of the Cafe Cherrier, a bistro at Cherrier & St. Denis.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Obnoxious Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayin this dump for the Grand Prix weekend and I thought I was going to catch some sort of plague from it's disgustingly dirty showers and bathrooms. One of the four showers, that served thirty people, only worked in the scalding hot position. I left a pair of sunglasses there when I left and even though I told the staff exactly where I left them and asked them nicely if they would look for them, they refused and when I called back the second time I was abruptly told that they were not found and then I was hung up on. Also the Air-Conditioning unit for the entire building was IN our room and even if you could stand the noise of it, it was impossible to sleep because it was too cold in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: EveyEire
Reviews.Content: They say on the hostel website that all the bathrooms and matresses are new; I don't know about the matresses but the bathrooms certainly were not new, they had mold on the walls and only one of the three toilets with showers locked and up to 40 people had to share those 3 toilets!! The bunk beds felt like they were about to fall apart and the room smelt damp. The staff are extremely rude and if you ask for a refund of your deposit after you see the room they won't give it back to you either! It is a rip-off for the quality you get. The Hotel La Residence next door actually worked out cheaper than the hostel!! (when u added the price of renting sheets, a towel and buying a little breakfast). It was small, but it was clean and they were very friendly. I wouldnt advise anyone to stay at the Hotel de Paris hostel, and i don't think the hotel is much better I heard from talking to guests staying in the hotel part, apart from one or two rooms that is.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel/Hostal”
Reviews.Author: C_jai4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel de Paris in May and it was very clean and neat... I went there with my girl and I must say that we are a very picky bunch, but we all agreed that this we would stay here for the weekend. I t was comfortable. We stayed in a budget suite for 4 adults I think it was, with two double beds and a 13' tv.. We had a view of the street so we see our car parked on the side street. There was not much parking . The parking for this building was in another building, how weird is that. It was very complicated. Whenever you went out you had to go to the front desk and ask for the key, then return it when you got your car out... A bit too much walking around. Terrible parking arrangements and they charge $8/day....... and you're not even garaunteed a parking because they share.. This hotel has no elevator so you have to stair it... Its located in an ok location. The clubs (try Cresent St. or St Laurent )are about 30 mins walk, eatry and other action St. Denis about 2 stop lights up ( very busy- a lot of food places and store along this street). Another busy street St Catherines. Don't forget to check out Victoria Sq... about 15 - 20 mins drive away. Overall this hotel was clean, beds were made, bathroom clean, cable tv - the staff was helpful somewhat friendly - parking sucks, but it is reasonable and clean, what more can you ask for... Don't be scared because it is a hostal because honestly, I didn't know about it until i read it somewhere and that was when I was leaving, checking out. It was nowhere near a hostal in my eyes.. The outer decor is a bit ancient but don't be fooled, the place is clean. Enjoy your stay like I did at Hotel De Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller hotel with nice clean rooms. I stayed in what was called a budget room with a double bed. The room was clean, with a cute bathroom and cable T.V. All in all, a great little place for the price. The hotel had nice staff, a great location and a good breakfast with plenty of parking. All in all we had a very pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Any other hotel is better! ANY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place must have one or two good rooms, if one is to believe the reviews, but the rest are a total pig sty! Smelly, smokey, filthy, old, thread-bare, utterly disgusting. I think the pictures on the net are fake, or hugely PhotoShopped. The staff is rude, too. These guys have buildings all over the street, nobody on site. Unbelievable bad choice. Any other hotel on Sherbrooke West is better, and cheaper! Don't waste your time and money, you may catch something from those sheets, too! UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Great locarion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually very good. The location is ideal. I had a luxury room at $125 canadian and everything was brand new including the furniture. The place was spotless. Also my daughter who will attend University in Montreal stayed at the adjacent youth hostel and had a good time and met some new friends, also students looking for apartments. Someone seems to have an axe to grind about this place. I was very satisfied.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 901 rue Sherbrooke East, Montreal, Quebec H2L 1L3, Canada
